repnme.cdata!:
Tunisia - Northwest Rural Development -
            Phase I - Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the project completion report
            for the Northwest Rural Development Project in Tunisia for
            which the loan was approved on May 15, 1981. The loan was
            closed on December 31, 1989, two years behind schedule. A
            sum of US$6.5 million was cancelled in 1987 and a further
            US$1.1 million was cancelled at closing. The primary
            objective of the project was to tackle the problems of the
            backward and depressed Northwest of Tunisia where the
            poorest sections of the rural population live. The project
            mainly achieved its targets in construction of
            infrastructure (building, roads, schools, and water points).
            This has increased social welfare (improved quantity and
            quality of water, provided schooling opportunities that were
            previously not available, etc.) and increased access to
            backward areas of the country thereby allowing marketing
            activities, delivery of inputs, and permitting improved
            delivery of health and administrative services. The primary
            reasons for shortfalls in implementation rate were
            organizational deficiencies, staff shortages, land tenure
            and use patterns, resistance of small-scale, subsistence
            farmers to accept perceived risks in changing production
            systems and failure to promote development of effective
            producer groups until toward the end of the project period.

docna.cdata!:
Tunisia - Northwest Rural Development -
            Phase I - Project

Tunisia - Northwest Rural

18212386.admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa

repnme.cdata!:
Tunisia - Northwest Rural Development -
            Phase I - Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed project would help finance
            a 5-year time slice of the Borrower's 15-year
            development program for the Northwest region which aims to
            increase the income and improve the nutrition, health, and
            education of the population while reducing soil erosion and
            thereby arresting the decline in agricultural productivity.
            The program would also create employment possibilities,
            develop local energy resources, and reduce the sedimentation
            rate of the Sidi Salem reservoir. The project would
            concentrate on establishing the institutions which would
            implement the program, including the Office, and the
            extension, research, credit, and livestock development
            services. The project would also start up specific
            agricultural, soil conservation and forestry activities,
            together with productive infrastructure works, and would
            include a foreign technical assistance component.

docna.cdata!:
Tunisia - Northwest Rural Development -
            Phase I - Project

repnme.cdata!:
Tunisia - First Phase Northwest Rural
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The First Phase Northwest Rural
            Development Project for Tunisia will help finance a 5-year
            time slice of the Borrower's 15-year development
            program for the Northwest region which aims to increase the
            income and improve the nutrition, health, and education of
            the population while reducing soil erosion and thereby
            arresting the decline in agricultural productivity. The
            program will also create employment possibilities, develop
            local energy resources, and reduce the sedimentation rate of
            the Sidi Salem reservoir. The project will concentrate on
            establishing the institutions which would implement the
            program, including the Office, and the extension, research,
            credit, and livestock development services. The project will
            also start up specific agricultural, soil conservation and
            forestry activities, together with productive infrastructure
            works, and would include a foreign technical assistance component.

Tunisia - First Phase Northwest Rural
